SEARCH
Package com.discretask.model

Class DiscretasksSystem

java.lang.Object
com.discretask.model.DiscretasksSystem
public class DiscretasksSystem extends Object
DiscretasksSystem is the class that represents the system, the controller of the application. It contains all the tasks and the methods to add, edit and delete them.

  • Method Details

    • addTask

      public Task addTask(String title, String content, Priority priority, String userCategory, Calendar deadline)
      The addTask function creates a new Task object with the given parameters, adds it to a collection of tasks, and returns the created task.
      Parameters:
      title - The title of the task.
      content - The content parameter is a string that represents the content or description of the task.
      priority - The priority of the task, which can be High, Medium, Low, Optional or Non-Priority.
      userCategory - The userCategory parameter is a String that represents the category or group to which the task belongs.
      deadline - The deadline parameter is a Calendar object that represents the deadline for the task.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a Task object.

    • addTaskUndo

      public Task addTaskUndo(Task task)
      The function adds a task to a collection and assigns it to a structure. This function is used to undo the operation of adding a task.
      Parameters:
      task - The parameter "task" is an object of type Task.
      Returns:
      The method is returning the added task.

    • editTask

      public void editTask(String id, String title, String content, Priority priority, String userCategory, Calendar deadline, boolean undo)
      The editTask function edits a task with the given parameters.
      Parameters:
      id - The id of the task.
      title - The title of the task.
      content - The content parameter is a string that represents the content or description of the task.
      priority - The priority of the task, which can be High, Medium, Low, Optional or Non-Priority.
      userCategory - The userCategory parameter is a String that represents the category or group to which the task belongs.
      deadline - The deadline parameter is a Calendar object that represents the deadline for the task.
      undo - The undo parameter is a boolean that represents if the operation is an undo or not.

    • assignTaskToStructure

      public void assignTaskToStructure(Task task)
      The function assigns a task to a data structure based on its priority level.
      Parameters:
      task - The "task" parameter is an object of the Task class.

    • removeTaskFromStructure

      public void removeTaskFromStructure(Task task)
      The function removes a task from a structure based on its priority.
      Parameters:
      task - The "task" parameter is an object of the Task class.

    • undo

      public void undo()
      The function pops a command from the operation stack and calls its `undo` method. This function is used to undo the last operation.

    • deleteTask

      public void deleteTask(String key, boolean undo)
      The deleteTask function removes a task from the collections and the hashtable, and adds a command to the operationStack for undo functionality if the method is not being called from the undo function.
      Parameters:
      key - The key is a unique identifier for the task that needs to be deleted. It is used to retrieve the task from the hashtable.
      undo - The `undo` parameter is a boolean value that indicates whether the deletion of the task should be undone or not. If `undo` is `true`, it means that the deletion is being undone and the task should be restored. If `undo` is `false`, it means that the deletion is not being undone and the task should be deleted.

    • getNonPriorityTasks

      public Queue<Task> getNonPriorityTasks()
      The function returns the queue of non-priority tasks.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a Queue of Task objects.

    • getPriorityTasks

      public Heap<Task> getPriorityTasks()
      The function returns the heap of priority tasks.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a Heap of Task objects.

    • getTasks

      public HashTable<String,Task> getTasks()
      The function returns the hash table of tasks.
      Returns:
      The method is returning a HashTable of Task objects.

    • getTasksByDeadLine

      public Heap<Task> getTasksByDeadLine()
      The function returns the heap of tasks sorted by their deadline.
      Returns:
      A Heap of Task objects is being returned.

    • getSortedHeap

      public Task[] getSortedHeap(String type)
      The function "getSortedHeap" returns a sorted array of tasks based on the specified type (either "DEADLINE" or "PRIORITY").
      Parameters:
      type - A string indicating the type of sorting to be performed. It can be either "DEADLINE" or "PRIORITY".
      Returns:
      The method is returning an array of Task objects.

    • mergeSort

      public void mergeSort(Task[] array, Comparator<Task> comparator)
      The mergeSort function sorts an array of Task objects using the merge sort algorithm and a given comparator.
      Parameters:
      array - The array parameter is an array of Task objects that needs to be sorted.
      comparator - The comparator is a function that defines the ordering of the elements in the array. It is used to compare two tasks and determine their relative order. The comparator should implement the `Comparator` interface and override the `compare` method.

    • merge

      public void merge(Task[] array, Task[] left, Task[] right, Comparator<Task> comparator)
      The merge function merges two sorted arrays into one sorted array using a comparator to determine the order.
      Parameters:
      array - The array parameter is the array that will be merged. It is the final merged array that will contain all the elements from the left and right arrays.
      left - An array of Task objects representing the left half of the array to be merged.
      right - The "right" parameter is an array of Task objects representing the right half of the array to be merged.
      comparator - The comparator is a function that compares two tasks and returns an integer value based on their order. It is used to determine the order in which the tasks should be merged in the final sorted array.

    • initSytem

      public void initSytem()
      The function initializes the system by creating tasks with different priorities and due dates.
